page.title: 08 St.John's Church
page.content: {Churches-Cont Methodist Church,All Saints R.C.Church {Burnhope St.Johns Church and Methodist Chapel. We visited St.Johns Church. {St.Johns Church St.Johns Church in Burnhope stands in the North East side of the village.It was built of brick in 1865.It has a square tower at the West end which houses a peal of brass tubular bells and a clock.The church has an arched shaped door and stained glass windows. Inside the church are plain wooden pews enough to seat one hundred people.The roof is wooden.To the right of the altar is a wooden lectern shaped like an eagle holding a Bible. To the left is a Book of Rememberance to help us remember the Burnhope men who died in the World Wars for us.Near the altar is an organ which makes the
